Row.Text: Steal 10% of an empire's total [ICON_GOLD] Gold income while you are at war with them and have a city within 10 tiles of their city, increasing to 25% if you have a military unit that is adjacent to their city.

Greetings to you, Joon, the most-despicable and disastrous god of pestilence! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The people of Gensokyo fear you. Those who do not fear you would soon known true terror in the form of financial ruin. Yet, even knowing this, these fools would still welcome you to their homes. It's like they want to be robbed! Perhaps they do enjoy spending their entire wealth, living as a spendthrift. In that case, it would be a pleasure to give them that lifestyle! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The fools are still calling out to you, begging for you to bring them financial ruin. Will you bring them the financial ruin they seek? Can you build a civilzation that would continue to grant these fools their wish, and would stand the test of time?

The Queen of Bubble is a unique unit for the Pestilent Empire, replacing the Paratrooper. Along with the normal Paratrooper abilities, it is naturally stronger, and grants you [ICON_GOLD] Gold when damaging cities.

Joon is also known as the Queen of Bubble. The bubble this is referring to was an economic period in Japan in which asset prices grows drastically, but would later burst like a bubble, and prices began to drop. The years following this incident would later be known as the Lost Decade, in which many lost their wealth, and thus, financial assets were consumed by pestilence.
Paratrooper unit. Only the Pestilent Empire may produce them. It is as strong as an Infantry, and steals [ICON_GOLD] Gold equal to 300% of the damage inflicted on a city.

The Swindlers' Guild is the Pestilent Empire's unique building, replacing the Bank. Although it provides less [ICON_GOLD] Gold, it steals 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn from neighboring cities, 10 tiles of range. It also provides military units trained in this city a promotion which grants additional [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units.

Pestilence gods are responsible for the consumption of financial assets. They are essentially swindlers, and would often use similar tricks to deprive a victim of their fortune. It is only natural that swindlers would often work with pestilence gods, as they also enjoy consuming financial assets.
+25% [ICON_GOLD] Gold. 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn is stolen from cities within 10 tiles. Military units trained in this city gain +33% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units.
Steals [ICON_GOLD] Gold equal to 300% of the damage inflicted on a city.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Debt Payment[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have received {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold from {2_PlayerName}! They still need to pay {3_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold!
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Debt of Pestilence[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have lost {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold! In addition, you still have a {2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold debt!
The Most-Despicable and Disastrous Younger Twin Sister

Joon is a pestilence god and one of the main antagonists of Antinomy of Common Flowers. Together with her older sister, Shion, she robs innocent residents of Gensokyo of their wealth by bringing them financial ruin.
Oh, I wasn't expecting visitors. If you've got something, my assistant is over there. Oh, where are my manners? I'm Yorigami Joon. I look forward to working with you.
You've come to the right place. I'm Yorigami Joon, and these are my little friends. I trust you will get along with them, yes?
Oh, a new face? ...I'm Yorigami Joon, and I run this place. You can do anything. But never go against the family.
A shame that it has to come to this. It's not personal, it's strictly business.
Even if you leave it alone the bills add up. I'm just taking what is rightfully mine.
What do you think about this offer, to settle your bills? I don't think you can refuse this one.
Revenge is a dish best served cold. I don't mind having it as long as my sister is safe.
I regret nothing, except not being able to make my sister happy. I hope you'll take good care of her.
All that's left for you is my sister. Please take good care of her.
Our people are now spending money like no tomorrow. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
